purpose: Chronological timeline of all documented violations and significant events during principal broker gap period (2014-2025)

violations_timeline.jurisdiction: U.S. District Court, District of Maryland
violations_timeline.allegations: Discriminatory practices based on race, hostile work environment, retaliation

violations_timeline.violation: Used Facebook advertisements to exclude individuals over 50 from receiving housing ads

violations_timeline.case: Coleman v. Kettler Management, et al.
violations_timeline.outcome: Court found isolated allegations insufficient to meet severe-or-pervasive standard

violations_timeline.activity: Started employment as Senior Regional Manager
violations_timeline.license_status: Confirmed unlicensed in VA, MD, DC

violations_timeline.violation: Policy of discriminating against housing voucher holders
violations_timeline.details: Denials and uninhabitable conditions in D.C. government-owned properties
violations_timeline.source: Washington City Paper, Equal Rights Center

violations_timeline.case: Equal Rights Center v. Kettler Management (Lawsuit filed)
violations_timeline.violation: Unlawfully refused to accept housing vouchers, imposed minimum income requirements on voucher holders

violations_timeline.source: Spotlight DC / Washington City Paper investigation
violations_timeline.details: Tenants at Jamison at Dakota Crossing received bills nearing $1,500 for 9 months despite unresolved maintenance issues

violations_timeline.case: Equal Rights Center v. Kettler Management (Settlement)
violations_timeline.jurisdiction: DC (6 properties: Rise at Temple Courts, Lotus Square, Solstice, Park Kennedy, Union Heights, Dock 79)
violations_timeline.violation: Source of income discrimination - unlawful refusal to accept housing vouchers
violations_timeline.details: Imposed unlawful minimum income and credit history requirements to reject voucher holders
violations_timeline.settlement_terms: Kettler agreed to affirmatively market that properties accept voucher holders and that minimum income and credit score requirements do not apply to them

violations_timeline.case: Wible v. Parcel D Property, LLC et al
violations_timeline.jurisdiction: U.S. District Court, District of Maryland

violations_timeline.violation: Unlicensed person making legal determinations about ADA/FHA accommodation requests
Unlicensed person making lease decisions affecting tenancy

significance: Documents pattern of violations and unlicensed practice during the 10.5-year period when Kettler Management operated without a principal broker in Virginia. Shows systematic issues across multiple jurisdictions and violation types.
